subject: Communication
title: The Sophists: Paid Teachers of Persuasion
description: One-minute skill: The Sophists: Paid Teachers of Persuasion.

hook.text: Before universities existed, traveling teachers called Sophists sold the most valuable skill: speech.

buildup.text: They charged enormous fees to teach wealthy Athenians how to argue, persuade, and win debates.

discovery.text: Protagoras, Gorgias, and Hippias became celebrities â€” the first professional communication coaches.

twist.text: Plato despised them, calling their work manipulation. He said they taught victory, not truth.

climax.text: Yet without Sophists, rhetoric might never have become a teachable skill studied for centuries.

punchline.text: The first speech coaches were also the first controversials.

quiz.question: Who criticized the Sophists for teaching persuasion over truth?
